result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher B Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Obtain and maintain employment satisfactory to his agent.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Someone called from DOC - the one Chippewa County Case # listed as one of the cases to be served consecutively is wrong.  I corrected it after verifying it and send CJOC.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Poss.  Defendant plead no contest to the charge.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties of the charge defendant plead to. Repeater allegation confirmed by the court.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea. Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Count 1. 15CM262 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Joint recommendation for 1 year probation consecutive to sentence now serving.  Obtain and maintain employment satisfactory to his agent.  Court ordered sentence withheld, 1 year probation. The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Obtain and maintain employment satisfactory to his agent.  CC.  Consecutive to Chippewa County case Nos. 10CF139 and 10CF320.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-21-2016 01:30 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-21-2016 01:30 pm
Recorded.  DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Poss.  Defendant is in Oak Hill Correctional.  Set for plea/sentencing.
Defendant appeared by video from Oakhill Correctional Institution with counsel SPD William Poss present in the courtroom.  DA Fox appeared for the State.

Pre-trial conference at 01-27-2016 10:00 am.
Status conference at 02-15-2016 03:00 pm.

Defendant appeared by video from Oakhill Correctional Institution with counsel SPD William Poss present in the courtroom.  DA Fox appeared for the State.  Defense waives reading of the complaints; defendant stands mute and requests pretrial and status conference dates.  Court entered not guilty plea, set pretrial for 1-27-16 at 10:00 and status conference for 2-15-16 at 3:00 with no appearance necessary by defendant.
Adjourned initial appearance at 01-07-2016 10:30 am
Defendant appeared by video from Oakhill Correctional.
Adjourned initial appearance at 12-14-2015 11:45 am

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from Oakhill Correctional.  Defendant sent a request to his social worker to be able to contact SPD.  He never got a response from the social worker.  Attorney Sebion will set up a telephone conference.  AIA set for 12/14/15 at 11:45 am.
Adjourned initial appearance at 11-30-2015 11:15 am
Talked to HZ in J.O. and the 12-3 date will not work for a VTC.  She will get back to me.
No appearance by defendant.  ADA Inlow - he is in the prison system.  Court scheduled VTC hearing on 12-3-15 at 10:00 for STC and/or Waiver of Counsel.
Mailed a waiver of counsel form to defendant.
Status conference at 11-23-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant appears by video from Oak Hill Correctional with no counsel present in courtroom.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant admits to receipt of both complaints.  Judge reviews charges and potential penalties of both cases.  Defendant understands charges/penalties.  He has not contacted SPD or attorney.  SPD Poss present in the courtroom and states the defendant should be able to talk to prison social worker and they can arrange a phone call to SPDO.  Court set for STC on 11-23-15 at 1:30.  Will not be contacting defendant by VTC.  Hopefully a public defender is appointed by then.  Clerk will mail defendant a waiver of attorney form and will proceed from there.  If he waives his right to an attorney then cases will then be set for a VTC date.
